overview: Throughout the South, vast numbers of African-American gravesites and burial grounds for enslaved persons have been lost or are disappearing through neglect and nature reclaiming the solemn tombstones and markers. Recently, there has been a rise in the restoration and preservation of these forgotten sites by those who have a personal connection with the deceased or an appreciation of their historical significance.  But there is much work to be done in order to preserve this part of Americaâ€™s history. Unmarked not only explores these untold stories of the past but also the efforts underway to preserve them.
tagline: If we don't save our past, we'll lose it
title: Unmarked
